title: Ethiopia: Diaspora Role in Catalyzing Country's Renaissance
text:
Nigeria: Over 500 West Africans Deported From Gabon Arrive Calabar 
This recognition has led to the decision to create the diaspora policy that is expected to exploit the accumulated potential of the Diaspora in the nation-building process. The introduction of the yellow card also entitle them the benefit of a citizen in socio-economic sectors, which has made an impact in attracting and motivating an increasing numbers to take part in investment in various areas. Consequentially, cash flow into the country through remittances and investment has also grown steadily. 
The Policy also allowed for a specific day- August 16- to be set aside for an annual celebration of the Ethiopian Diaspora. Ethiopia, therefore, is set to celebrate Diaspora week to help boost contribution of Ethiopians living abroad in the development endeavors of the country. Over 6,000 Ethiopian Diasporas drawn from all over the world are expected to attend the event that will commence the coming August 16. 
A Diaspora Day has a number of benefits including providing the creation of an opportunity for the Ethiopian Diaspora all over the world to engage with one another ;to connect with the people at home and create a chance for the young generation abroad to see something of their country and fully experience its culture and be an ambassador of their country. More importantly it is an opportunity to assess and evaluate the development activities accomplished so far and allow the Diaspora to voice matters of concern, among others. 
The Diaspora can make a huge difference to the country development in every aspect. As many bespeak the Diaspora active engagement would play crucial role in investing in economic sector also in attracting investment and can create a positive image of the country and draw more tourists in the country. 
The contribution of Ethiopian Diaspora to the country's development is growing from time to time, but doesn't reach the desired level yet. Unfortunately, yet, the Diaspora has not been effectively mobilized, networked abroad neither engaged across sectors at the level it should. First of all,to activate maximum use of the Diaspora resources, the relationship must be institutionalized. And, for that to be realized, challenges such as lack of good governance and the bureaucratic bottlenecks have to be addressed effectively. 
In response,the government has established formal mechanisms to encourage and facilitate Diaspora engagement, specific departments are set within the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, that has the mandate to assist and cooperate with the Diaspora. It has also encouraged the replication of the federal level initiatives and systems at regional level. These efforts, are accompanied by a range of policy reforms and other measures to facilitate the Diaspora participation. 
Hence,if the government wants to establish strategic involvement of the Diaspora and harness the invaluable resources to spur the economic growth it needs to transform the public institutions that has direct contact with them. It needs to enhance their capacity,above all, it needs to work on the public servants physiological mindset: Serving is a privilege not the other way round. 
On the part of the Diaspora, the peoples of this land are making history and taking their lives in their own hands. Fellow Diasporas now have the chance to be part of that history of change and transformation. Ethiopia
